title: Rains to enhance in several parts of the island from today
byline: From today (28), the rainy condition is expected to temporarily enhance over Northern, North-central, Eastern, Uva, Southern, and Central provinces for the next few days, the Department of Meteorology says.

title: UK Minister for Indo-Pacific visits Sri Lanka; focus on economy & reconciliation talks
byline: The UK Minister for the Indo-Pacific is set to meet with new Sri Lankan government minsters as part of the first official visit of new UK government.

title: US Justice Dept. fires over a dozen employees who helped prosecute Trump
byline: About a dozen Justice Department employees who worked for former special counsel Jack Smith on the investigation and prosecution of President Trump are being fired, two sources familiar with the matter confirmed to CBS News.

title: Planetary parade: Rare alignment of 6 planets visible to naked eye in Sri Lanka
byline: A rare celestial event is captivating stargazers as six planets align in a striking display, says Professor Chandana Jayaratne, Director of the Astronomy and Space Sciences Unit at the University of Colombo’s Department of Physics.

title: Lectures suspended as Jaffna Uni. teachers launch strike action
byline: The Jaffna University Teachers’ Union has commenced a strike, withdrawing from conducting all lectures at the university.

title: Planetary parade: Rare alignment of 6 planets visible to naked eye in Sri Lanka
byline: A rare celestial event is captivating stargazers as six planets align in a striking display, says Professor Chandana Jayaratne, Director of the Astronomy and Space Sciences Unit at the University of Colombo’s Department of Physics.

title: UK Minister for Indo-Pacific meets PM, discusses “Clean Sri Lanka” initiative
byline: Catherine West, Member of the UK Parliament and Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office Minister for the Indo-Pacific, paid a courtesy call on Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, on January 27, 2025, at the Prime Minister’s Office.

title: New regulations stipulate vehicle import limits and re-export requirements
byline: An extraordinary gazette notification under the Import and Export Control Act was issued yesterday (27), introducing revised regulations for vehicle imports for importers and commercial banks involved in vehicle import transactions.

title: Japan defeats France to win the Pastry World Cup
byline: It’s a matter of national pride, with carefully chosen teams spending years training in pursuit of winning the highest honor in their fields and representing their country on the global stage.

title: Racket of mixing white rice with red rice uncovered amid market shortage
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has uncovered a racket where some traders are mixing white rice to red rice in order to meet market demands, following the shortage of red rice.

title: Special Commodity Levy on dates reduced
byline: A Gazette notification has been issued reducing the existing Special Commodity Levy of Rs. 200 on Dates to Rs. 01 per kilogram.

title: Govt will make all decisions to uplift living standards of people - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has stated that the current government is determined to make all necessary decisions for the country’s advancement and to improve the quality of life for its citizens.

title: Sri Lanka Economic Summit kicks off today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will inaugurate the Sri Lanka Economic Summit organized by the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce which kicks off today (28) to a sold-out audience at the Shangri La Hotel, Colombo.

title: Tech stock selloff deepens as DeepSeek triggers AI rethink
byline: Japanese technology shares fell on Tuesday as a global market rout sparked by the emergence of a low-cost Chinese artificial intelligence model entered day two, with investors questioning the sky-high valuation and dominance of AI bellwethers.

title: Former President Mahinda holds special discussion with ex-SLPP members
byline: A special discussion has taken place under the patronage of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at his residence in Wijerama Mawatha last night (27).

title: Former MP Mavai Senathirajah hospitalised
byline: The leader of the Ilankai Thamil Arasu Kachchi’s (ITAK) politburo, former MP Mavai Senathirajah has been hospitalised.

title: Govt. to implement interest subsidy scheme for minor and small-scale farmers annually
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to implement “Sarusara,” interest subsidy scheme as an annual program from the year 2025.

title: Independence Day rehearsals to begin tomorrow; Special traffic plan in place
byline: Sri Lanka Police have announced that rehearsals for the 77th Independence Day celebrations will commence from tomorrow (29).

title: Johann Peries becomes first Sri Lankan to summit Antarctica’s highest mountain
byline: Johann Peries has reached the summit of Mount Vinson, the highest mountain in Antarctica at 4,892 metres, to become the first Sri Lankan and one of the few islanders in the world to achieve this incredible feat.

title: President Dissanayake’s congratulatory message to President Trump handed over
byline: Sri Lankan Ambassador to the United States Mahinda Samarasinghe has visited the US Department of State and handed over the congratulatory message of President Anura Kumara Disanayaka addressed to President Donald Trump on his assumption of office as the 47th President of the United States of America.

title: LG elections in April – Minister confirms
byline: The Cabinet Spokesman, Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa confirmed that the Local Government (LG) Elections will be held in April, 2025.

title: Govt. will not lift rice price controls – Minister
byline: Cabinet Spokesperson Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa stated that the government has no intention of lifting the price control on rice.

title: Govt clarifies delay in setting guaranteed price for paddy purchase
byline: Cabinet Spokesman, Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa says that steps will be taken to establish a guaranteed price for paddy purchase as soon as market prices begin to decline.

title: India lodges protest with Sri Lanka against firing over fishermen
byline: India, on Tuesday, lodged a strong protest with Sri Lanka over an incident of firing by the Sri Lankan Navy during the apprehension of 13 Indian fishermen in the proximity of Delft Island in the early hours of this morning.

title: 21-hour water cut in parts of Anuradhapura
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced a 21-hour water cut from tomorrow (29) to the January 30 due to cleaning and essential maintenance work at the Nuwarawewa Water Treatment Plant in Anuradhapura.

title: New chairpersons appointed for several Parliamentary Committees
byline: The Parliament of Sri Lanka has announced the election of new chairpersons for several Parliamentary Committees.

title: Third round of SJB-UNP talks tonight
byline: Another round of discussions between the United National Party (UNP) and the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) is scheduled to take place tonight (28).

title: Namal Rajapaksa indicted over ‘Krrish’ deal
byline: The Attorney General has filed indictments against SLPP Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa on charges of criminal misappropriation of Rs. 70 million in connection with the controversial Krrish project.

title: Minister clarifies controversy over award presented to Emil Ranjan
byline: Cabinet Spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa emphasized that the killing of individuals in government custody is completely unacceptable.

title: Previous govts also imported salt, says Minister
byline: The government has stated that measures to import salt have been undertaken not only by the incumbent government but also by previous governments.

title: Air quality expected to drop to slightly unhealthy levels
byline: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO) has announced that Sri Lanka’s Air Quality Index (AQI) is expected to range between 58 and 120 throughout the day.

title: Approval granted for regional-level service delivery via President’s fund
byline: The Board of Governors of the President’s Fund convened today (28) at the Presidential Secretariat under the leadership of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to outline plans and initiatives for the year 2025.

title: Fighting rages in Congo’s Goma while embassies attacked in capital
byline: Dead bodies lay in the streets, gunfire rang out and hospitals were overwhelmed in east Congo’s largest city on Tuesday, as M23 rebels backed by Rwanda faced pockets of resistance from army and pro-government militias.

title: Several traders fined Rs. 6.5 mln for selling rice at inflated prices
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has announced that its operations to identify and take action against rice traders selling at inflated prices will continue, with additional teams deployed across the island.

title: Customs levies taxes on dates donated by Saudi for Ramadan
byline: It was revealed today (28) that Sri Lanka Customs has imposed taxes on the stock of dates donated by Saudi Arabia as a gift for the Ramadan fasting season.

title: Govt will amend and implement Economic Transformation Act - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that the government intends to implement the Economic Transformation Act with amendments.

title: Govt ready for a structural change of SOEs - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that the government is ready for a structural change in loss-making state-owned enterprises.

title: Serbian prime minister quits as anti-corruption protests persist
byline: Serbian Prime Minister Milos Vucevic resigned on Tuesday, becoming the highest-ranking official to step down amid a wave of anti-corruption protests that have spread across the Balkan country.
